sen.j: 清順（せいじゅん、生年不詳 - 永禄9年4月3日 (旧暦)（1566年4月22日））は、戦国時代_(日本)の臨済宗尼。
sen.e: Seijun (the year of birth unknown - April 22, 1566) was a nun of the Rinzai Sect in the Sengoku period (Japan).
Seijun (year of birth unknown - May 2, 1566) was a nun of the Rinzaishu sect in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直し、統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Seijun (year of birth unknown - May 2, 1566) was a nun of the Rinzaishu sect in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).

sen.j: 伊勢神宮の式年遷宮復興に尽力した。
sen.e: She devoted herself to Shikinensengu (periodical rebuilding of a shrine carried out every predetermined number of years) and restoration of Ise Jingu Shrine.
She devoted herself to restore Shikinensengu (periodical rebuilding of a shrine carried out every predetermined number of years) of Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 紀伊国熊野郡出身とも近江国出身とも言われる。
sen.e: Seijun is said to be from Kumano County, Kii Province or from Omi Province.

sen.j: 慶光院2世宝山智珪に師事して後に慶光院を譲られた。
sen.e: Seijun became a disciple of the second Hozan Chikei of Keiko-in Temple and the temple was later handed over to her.
Seijun became a disciple of the second Hozan Chikei (宝山智珪) of Keiko-in Temple which was later handed over to her.
sen.cmt: 読みが確認できない語の漢字を補足しました。
sen.e: Seijun became a disciple of the second Hozan Chikei (宝山智珪) of Keiko-in Temple which was later handed over to her.

sen.j: 天文_(日本)18年（1549年）に五十鈴川にかかる宇治橋 (伊勢市)の架け替えのために諸国行脚をして勧進を行い成功を収める。
sen.e: In 1549, Seijun went on a pilgrimage to various districts and successfully solicited funds for rebuilding of Uji-bashi Bridge over Isuzu River.
In 1549, Seijun went on a pilgrimage to various districts and successfully solicited funds for rebuilding of Uji-bashi Bridge (Ise City) over the Isuzu-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせ、補足しました。
sen.e: In 1549, Seijun went on a pilgrimage to various districts and successfully solicited funds for rebuilding of Uji-bashi Bridge (Ise City) over the Isuzu-gawa River.

sen.j: 後奈良天皇はその報を聞いて、特に清順に上人号贈り、その庵に「慶光院」の号を授けた。
sen.e: Having heard the news, Emperor Gonara gave Seijun the title of Shonin (high priest) in particular and conferred the title of 'Keiko-in' to her monastery.
Having heard the news, Emperor Gonara gave Seijun the title of Shonin (high priest) in particular and conferred the title of 'Keikoin' to her monastery.
Having heard the news, Emperor Gonara gave Seijun the title of Shonin (high priest) in particular and conferred the title of 'Keikoin' to her monastery.

sen.j: その後、100年以上途絶えいていた伊勢神宮の式年遷宮再興のために再び勧進比丘尼として諸国を行脚、永禄6年（1563年）、まず豊受大神宮の遷宮を実現させた。
sen.e: Later, Seijun made her pilgrimage to various districts again as a Kanjin bikuni (nun soliciting funds) for the Shikinensengu restoration of Ise Jingu Shrine, which had been suspended for more than 100 years, and she first realized the transfer of Toyouke Dai-jingu Shrine for rebuilding in 1563.

Later, Seijun made her pilgrimage to various districts again as a Kanjin bikuni (nun soliciting funds) for the Shikinensengu restoration of the Ise-jingu Shrine, which had been suspended for more than 100 years, and she first realized the transfer of Toyouke Dai-jingu Shrine for rebuilding in 1563.

Later, Seijun made her pilgrimage to various districts again as a Kanjin bikuni (nun soliciting funds) for the Shikinensengu restoration of the Ise-jingu Shrine, which had been suspended for more than 100 years, and she first realized the transfer of Toyouke Dai-jingu Shrine for rebuilding in 1563.

sen.j: 続いて皇大神宮の遷宮のための勧進を計画するが間もなく病没した。
sen.e: She then planned temple solicitation for the transfer of Kotai-jingu Shrine but died from an illness shortly.
She then planned temple solicitation for the transfer of Kotai-jingu Shrine but died from an illness shortly.

sen.j: その後、門人たちによって天正13年（1585年）に内宮外宮同時の神宮式年遷宮が実現することになった。
sen.e: Later, the simultaneous Jingu Shikinensengu rebuilding of the inner and outer shrines was realized by its disciples in 1585.
Later, the simultaneous Jingu Shikinensengu (rebuilding of the inner and outer shrines of the Ise-jingu Shrine) was realized by its disciples in 1585.
